meanings.definition: One who embellishes or adds decorative details.
meanings.sent1: The embellisher carefully added sparkles to the costume.
meanings.sent2: The talented embellisher enhanced the painting with intricate designs.
meanings.sent3: The embellisher joked that even a plain rock could use some glitter.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like an embellisher, adding beauty to the story.
meanings.sent5: The embellisher's work transformed the room into a magical space.

meanings.definition: To make something more attractive by the addition of decorative details.
meanings.sent1: She decided to embellish the dress with colorful ribbons.
meanings.sent2: He likes to embellish his stories with exciting adventures.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to embellish the cake with extra frosting.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to embellish the joy of the moment.
meanings.sent5: The flowers embellished the garden with vibrant colors.
